byline.contributor: Mohammed Ali Kalfood reported from Sana, Kareem Fahim from Cairo, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Saeed Al-Batati contributed reporting from Al Mukalla, Yemen.
byline.original: By MOHAMMED ALI KALFOOD, KAREEM FAHIM and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Islamic State affiliate in Yemen, calling itself Sana Province, claims responsibility for coordinated suicide strikes on Zaydi Shiite mosque in capital Sana that killed more than 130 people during Friday prayer; group had not previously carried out any major attacks, underscoring how situation in country has deteriorated since Houthi rebels seized power.
lead_paragraph: An affiliate of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attacks at two Zaydi Shiite mosques in Sana, the capital.

headline.main: Suicide Attacks at Mosques in Yemen Kill More Than 130
headline.print_headline: Militants Linked to ISIS Say They Killed Yemenis

snippet: An affiliate of the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attacks at two Zaydi Shiite mosques in Sana, the capital.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
